text:
Pours black with a film of tan head. Aroma is dark and smoky with chocolate espresso notes. Flavor is initially bitter and then silky smooth. There is a bitter bourbon flavor that clings to the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an inky black and makes a thin brown head, with a bit a lacing. Aroma is of roasted barley and cocoa. Tastes of smoky, roasted barley and chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tasty stout, with subtle rye contribution. Maybe it was coming in from too much cold, but a tad weak on mouthfeel. Still very good drinkability.Another good addition to this series.

Aroma is very similar to a stout or porter, with chocolate and coffee notes. Black body with off white head. Flavor is really just coffee and cream - I dont think it has the "evolution" that is promised. The rye finish is slightly spicy but good.

Big & black. Dark roasty appealing gentle smell. Stouty at first with perhaps some rye in thar, difficult to feel initially. Its trying to get up to IPA bitterness but just cant seem to get there. Middle becomes more difficult and ruder with a choco malt background. Nasty Nellie style. Cannot appreciate. Each sip evolves from nice roasty stout to astringent near impy.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Draft @ Söder om Småland, Malmö. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty milky chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate finish with weak hints of caramel.
Chocolate, bitter, black, hint of alcohol, heavy sweet, medium bitter. Unbalanced. Meh

Bottle
Black deep black, minimal head.
Aroma of chocolate coffee, dust and rye 
Taste sweet, surprisingly round feel, chocolate tones, coffe bitterness.
Like.
Got from beer hawk monthly beer club and the appearance/smell were appealing but I found the ginger too strong for my taste

(Bottle) Dark brown colour, almost black, with frothy, lasting beige head. Malty, roasted nose with dark chocolate, dried fruit (figs, dates), coffee, black rye bread and a touch of treacle. Malty, roasted taste with notes of dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, black rye bread, a touch of burnt sugar and a generous roasty bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, mainly dry. Tasty and well balanced with a velvety, rounded mouthfeel. Nice one.
Bottle from systembolaget sweden. Small brown head. Big chocolate aroma with a small fruity tuch. Smooth chocolate taste and balanced bitterness. Medium body.

12/22/13- Pours dark brown/black with a 2 inch tan head. Head retention is good, and theres also a lot of lacing. The brew smells like roasted malt, dark/rye bread, nuts and some coffee. It tastes like roasted and burnt/charred malt, bittersweet chocolate, dark/rye bread, nuts, and a bit of molasses and coffee. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit slick and coating, with moderate carbonation. Overall another good beer from the Fade To Black Series.
Really nice. Very much like a black IPA. Dark with a cream head. Aroma and flaovrs of coffee, roasted malt, pepper and licorice. Smooth and full palate.
Not bad could live with or without it. Nice brown colour not much head. Leaves a plesent taste in your mouth.
At Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival, Friday 13, 2015.Bottled.Black color, light brown head. Sweet raosted scent. Sweet, grainy, roasted taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Bitter aftertaste.
bottle from beer hawk really not for me this one very dark in colour slight white head sweet and coffee in the aroma i got licorice spicy on the finish
Did not even know there were different versions. The bottle does not say much. It was dark and graspy and quite nice to drink.

Comes out of tap coffee brown with a thin tan head. Smoky aroma has coffee, chocolate, and rye notes - rich and very tempting! Bold flavor has roast malt, quality coffee, toasty rye, earthy, and nutty notes. A winner! Heavy mouthfeel has some good fizz. This is a must.
Draft at Third Base. Pours black with small tan head and rings of lacing. Nose is roasted grain. Taste is coffee and chocolate. Lasting bitterness in the aftertaste.

[6143-20140124] Bottle. Burnt grainy coffee roast aroma. Hazy, dark brown body with a quick foamy off-white head. Coffee roast flavour has a mild cigarettes burnt wood note. Medium-full body. Average, seems like a porter. (6/3/7/3/13) 3.2
2014 Fade to Black, Tap @ The Beer Market Bolingbrook: Pint glass, nearly opaque with a small head and not much lace. Lots of rye, quite dry, toasty and not sweet. Marbled rye in the glass, yummy

Dark black, smell of liqurice, rosted malt and coffey. The head dies quickly and disapears. Sweet taste of chocolate, liqurice and coffey. It taste as it smells. This is a nice beer a cold and dark evening.

Tallahassee, Fl - Growler Country - via a growler (thanks for the trade Aurelius). Reddish black deep dark inky pour with a quickly fading off-white head. Some minty rye in the aroma, a touch of licorice and creosote. Flavor has a similar profile as the aroma with some licorice and creosote, a touch of chocolate, a hint of black coffee. Pleasantly thick mouhfeel Pretty solid - did not know this was a series - may have scrolled past a few of these in the past
Inky black with a loose tan head. Lots of chocolate and coffee, a little rye acid twang in the flavor and aroma. A little creosote. Mouthy. Growler County, Tallahassee.

12oz. bottle. Dark malt aroma with suggestions of dark chocolate, spicy rye, coffee, maple sugar, earthy hop and faint smoke. Deep, dark brown in color with a very fine, lasting, khaki head. Flavor profile is nicely hoppy, spicy, earthy and darkly sweet, with more semi-sweet chocolate, licorice and faint coffee, blending with the rye and lightly piney, leafy hop presence, closing with a light-moderate dosage of bitterness. Smooth and lightly viscous on the palate with fine effervescence and a medium-full body. Interesting and tasty stuff.
Bottle. Pours dark blackish brown with tan head. Nose was rye, coffee, maple, mild oaky, molasses, nuts. Complex flavor with coffee, roasty dark malt, walnuts, oak, and a dense and smooth mouthfeel.

22/VIII/14 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from a trade @ home - BB: V/2014 (2014-934) Thanks to hackobock for the trade!
Clear dark purple brown beer, creamy beige to brown head, little stable, dissipates quickly, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: milk chocolate, grains, bit dusty, molasses, spicy, cinnamon, cloves. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: spicy start, some cooked vegetables, lots of pumpkin spices, soft bitterness, sweet, little roasted, sour touch. Aftertaste: pumpernickel bread, sourish, bit lemony, toast, cocoa powder, bit of alcohol, soft bitterness, a touch of cooked vegetables, liquorish, spicy ending.

Dark copper, coca-cola color, very smooth texture, full body, flavorfull, long palate, bitter but not dry, crisp, roast flavors, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Bottle). Dominant aroma of roasted malt and hops. The taste is heavily roasted, slightly burnt malt. Also hints of pepper and chocolate, maybe also some licorice. In the aftertaste hints of burnt malt.

Pours perfectly black into the glass, with a light ring of lace that dissipates into trace spot lacing. The nose is of roasts, chocolates and agave indeed. Flavors have predominantly roasts and chocolates, rye all the way through the earthy finish, which ends with a kiss of licorice. The mouthfeel is smooth and spicy on the palate. Nice newest incarnation of the Fade to Black series.
Great beer overall. Nice roast and chocolate taste. Quickly fading aftertaste.

Bottle. Sweet earthy roasted malt aroma. Black brown with a moderate tan head. Sweet molasses and roasty/ashy malt and cola flavor - not really getting any rye. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice, and easy to drink.
12 ounce bottle. Poor is a dark with a thin brown head.. Taste of spicy grain and smoky.. slight hops.. Good body..

Pours dark brown with super huge off white head...light lacing....nose is malt coffee licorice....taste is dark chocolate,coffee,malt,dark berries...very tasty beer....i do not taste the pepper....which i feel is a good thing...thumbs up to this one!

[Tap] Draught at a Left Hand tap takeover. Very dark brown pour with a small amount of light brown head. Nose is of spicy rye grain, charred malts and noticeable anise. Taste profile includes roasted malts, cocoa, mild coffee and rye spice. Dry and peppery finish. Nice balance and good looking lacing on the side of the glass. Good stuff.

Black with a foamy white head. Aroma is bitter toasted malt and oak. Flavor taste a bit like carbdoard. Yeah Ive had it! Otherwise tastes like a milk stout. Has that lactose sweetness and thickness to the body.
Draught at Beer Pub Bamboo, Shinjuku. Black - white head. Licorice. Ok burned malts. Earthy. Chocolate. Dark dark chocolate. Coffee. Acid. Nice.
Pours dark with a thin head into a goblet glass. Notes of dark fruit and coffee, with a hint of nut. Smooth and enjoyable.

Tap at Pizza Luce. Deep brown with no head. Aromas of smokey wood, rye, maple syrup and a little burnt sugar. Taste is quite sweet with a woody dryness. Heavier body with a syrupy feel and fine carbonation.

12oz bottle pours with a deep dark body that supports a thin mocha colored head (man I love this beer series). The aroma offers up chocolate, a thin dark roasted malt note and other faint clouds of aroma I cant really make out. The taste starts smooth and creamy and it brings up notes of malt sweetened black licorice, chocolate bar and a thin ribbon of dark roasted malts. Theres a dollop of resiny hops and a rye bread twang that surface about midway and ride into the finish. Darn tasty brew.

Pours dark brown, nearly black with a caramel colored head. Tons of lacing. Aroma is chocolate malt and rye. Taste is smooth with a bit of roasted malt and rye. Nice finish of alcohol...not real bitter. Nice beer.

12oz bottle 3/14/14 (Binnys Plainfield Mix A Six)-40° in Shaker-Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of rye, coffee, malt, and chocolate. Taste of the same with a nice hop flavor along with more chocolate and coffee. This medfium bodied brew is well balanced and quite tasty. Great Job.

Best by April 29, 2014.
Appearance: The body seems opaque but under a bright light some garnet hues appear around all but the center. The body appears murky, but a nice color. The head is short and khaki, poor retention. It settles to a thin, but full, coating with a creamy ring.
Aroma: The aroma leans a little sweet with bittersweet chocolate and a slightly herbal quality. Licorice shows through, but doesnt dominate. The aroma is pleasant with good strength.
Taste: The flavor is a nice blend of chocolate and hints of bitterness with a slight licorice and roasted finish. No real rye is showing, perhaps a touch on the base, but this is mostly chocolate and licorice.
Palate: Soft bodied, a bit flat tasting.
Overall: This is a decent rye stout, but the licorice throws it off a bit for me. I also feel like this is a bit muddy in flavor, no real stand out flavors. This drinks nicely though, I just wouldnt buy it again.

Deep brown with only a hint of foam. Spicy aroma of rye but theres some noticeable chocolate and citrus too. Medium bodied. Chocolate and toasted malts allow the hop to balance and the rye to add complexity.

Dark brown with a tan head and light lacing. Aroma of roast, rye, earth, and chocolate. Taste is rich with some rye spice and moderate sweet and bitter flavors. Creamy, medium bodied, with soft carbonation. Pretty good.

Dark brown with ruby hilites and rimming tan head; aroma is slightly chocolatey, slightly roasty; flava is roasty, hints of chocolate and grainy spice; feels light with moderate fizz; finishes roasty dry and grainy/rye notes
Hel del chocklad i aromen, lite kokos sötma?! Bra balans i kropp och smak. Lite rostade toner va.

12oz bottle from Georgios, Billerica, MA. A black pour with a ring of cream froth; chocolate and coffee aromas; thinly bodied, with a sourness from the rye and a chocolate taste with a touch of licorice; then a dry peppery finish. Pleasant stuff.
Bottle at home. Black beer with an offwhite not lasting head. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, malty aroma. Similar flavour but feels a bit thin.
Bottled. Pours black with a huge brown head. Smells salty, licorice, roasted malt. Tastes dark coffee, roasted malt, a bit sweet bread malty with a slight roasted malt bitter finish.

Sample at World of Beer Easton. Dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma of roast, spicy rye and strange botanical/fruity character. Flavor is pretty much the same with a nice roasty/spicy rye front and weird botanical/fruity finish.

Clear mahogany-brown-black with a dark khaki head. Aroma - sweet/dark chocolate, dark toast, coffee/espresso. Taste - touch of sweetness, not very bitter, coffee/dark toast/dark chocolate. Slightly heavy mouthfeel, though not like an imperial stout. Like a robust porter. Very, very nice. Definitely recommended.

Bottle. Light hazy deep brown liquid with small off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, licorice, bread, biscuit and caramel. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of chocolate, bread, licorice and coffee. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Ok.

12 oz bottle pours a brownish black color with a medium tan head that leaves good lacing. Smells of chocolate, rye, roasted malt, caramel and burnt toast. Taste is similar to the smell with a peppery rye bread flavor in the back end. Mouthfeel is creamy and silky with great carbonation and a dry finish. Another good one from left hand they sure know how to make good stouts.

Flaska från SB. Brunsvart vätska med kaffefärgat skum. Chokladig, jordig doft med lite sylt i bakgrunden. Len, torr smak med inslag av svarta vinbär och cigarr. Fräsig fyllig munkänsla. Medellång eftersmak.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, best before 4/1/2014. Pours pitch black color with a 2 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, cocoa, dark bread, rye, caramel, molasses, toast, light smoke, floral, light pine, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good complexity of dark/roasted malt and light-moderate hop presence; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, dark bread, roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, toast, rye, caramel, brown sugar, light smoke, floral, and roasted earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, dark bread, roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, rye, toast, caramel, brown sugar, light smoke, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt flavors; with great robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very creamy and lightly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very nice rye black ale. All around good robustness and complexity of dark/roasted malt flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. Did not have as much hops in the flavor as I expected, but was a very enjoyable offering otherwise.

Pours a nice dark body with a thin head. Some bread tones but otherwise a quite mild taste. A very nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased at Hollywood Liquors in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home during a frozen winter with a cat on my lap after taking a de-icing bath. I also enjoyed this during the Super Bowl, which was less than super. Appearance is pitch black, moderate consistency, small off white head that rims around the glass. Aroma is mostly of chocolate and rye, definite maple notes along with bitter coffee, very nice and subtle. Taste is also heavy on the chocolate malt and goes down with equal parts roasted and sweet. Goes down especially "slippery", which is a stupid characteristic for a liquid, but I cant think of a better word. Its pretty good.
12oz bottle. Poured a dark brown, almost black color, with an off white head. Toasted rye, roast, some coffee, and some earthy/woodiness.
Det här var en juste sak, smaken är balanserad med toner av choklad, kaffe, syra och äpple. Slutsats; maltig och behaglig sak.

Flaska från SB. Riktigt mörkbrun, lågt snabbt försvinnande skum. Fina rostade och lätt söta dofter med nymalt kaffe, rostade nötter, choklad och torkad frukt. Smak av lakrit, mörkt bröd, nötter, kaffe, skalet på svartpeppar och en lite kryddig och jordig eftersmak. Lätt beska, bra balans, riktigt trevlig.

Left hand fade to black
2014-01-25. Black body nice tan head. 3++ Aroma is lightly roasty and tangy, dark malt, muted smokey accents. Flavour is tangy and roasty with a whisper of earthy not quite smoke like character, spicey touches. Average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. Decent. Bottle shared by DuctTape

﻿Pours black with brown head. O the coffee aromas is wonderful, and cacao, roasted malts. Nutty flavor and coffee, chocolate and some nice rye flavor in the finish. Really smooth and its almost 8%, nicely done!

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2014 355ml bottle.
Pours a dark brown, almost black, with a beige head.
Spicy aroma, roasted malt, licorice, coffee, mint, hops, eucalyptus. 
Dry, medium bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Spicy taste, roasted malt, licorice, mint, chocolate, ashes, earth, ground coffee, hops.
Quite complex, but fairly easy drinking. However, I feel there is a certain lack of structure, it finishes quite abruptly, almost watery.(2014-01-31)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Black with a tan head. Aroma is spicy rye for the most part with a little of something similar to oat. Taste starts the same but the rye fades a bit and leaves some chocolate and almost marshmallow like sweetness. Rich mouthfeel with moderate carb. Enjoyable.

Bottle from Yamaichi. Big, nutty, malty nose, caramel, lightly spicy (rye), raisin, slightly woody. Dull brown to black with lace. Sweet yet not overly so, spicy rye, grainy malts, fruity, coffee, wood, nuts. Smooth, full body. Nice

Light aroma of coffee but the smell of a lot of alcohol. The taste was not that tasty anyway. Have a little sweetness, coffee and maybe licorice. An okay bitterness finishes the beer is left to a weak long while atop the tongue. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Solid offering from a great brewery with a stable of good beers. The flavor is consistent from start to finish. Nothing to complain about during the whole experience. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle from Dutchs- thanks again, Chris! Pours a deep coffee brown with a medium beige head that leaves spots of lace. Aroma of toast, nuts, leaves, rye, chocolate, and dust. Flavor of roasted malts, rye, root beer, cola, brown sugar, toast, and nuts. Medium-bodied, with a roasty, spicy mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Good black rye ale.

Bottle @ home shared by LeninCat. Thanks Lenin! Pours a dark brown appearance with thin to moderate sized brown head. Fairly roasty, slight rye, cookie dough, dark chocolate aroma. Kind of creamy, burnt sugar, a bit earthy, chocolate, bready flavor. Im not too crazy about this release but it may be a bit past its prime.

Deep black pour, thin tan head. Lots of earthy wood and spiciness. Nothing overbearing from the hops. Kinda reminds me of the Magic Hat Seance but a little heavier. Still very drinkable for such a dark beer and it relies on some fancy malt and yeast flavor to carry it through. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BBD 4/29/14. Black pour with a reasonable head and lacing. Light nose of roast and chocolate, somewhat less than a typical porter, although this is a black ale. Almost medium body coupled with an almost slick mouthfeel. Normal carbonation. The flavor profile is complex, interesting and quite nice. Roast and chocolate comprise the forefront against a slight malt sweetness. This is followed by a burst of light bitterness against a slight rye spiciness and smoke. Smooth finish that is accentuated by the rye spiciness and a slight lingering bitterness. My first Left Hand offering, and it is outstanding.
Earthy coffee aroma. Taste adds anise and peppery spice with a rye bread finish.

Bottle @ home. Dark brown color and a tiny beige head, Aromas are mild but complex of dark chocolate, sweet dark fruits, rye, roasted coffee . Some oak, dark bread, vanilla and dark sugars. Full bodied with smooth delicate carbonation. Taste is sweet initially, and roasted with lots of dark fruits, rye, dark chocolate, espresso, some citrus. Aftertaste is dry with wood, rye and a significant almost salty bitterness of grape and chocolate. The bitterness stays long and finishes harsh lemon-like, sour and dry.

Black body, small tan head. Aroma is weak, I cant really pick up anything. Taste is also weak. Theres a hint of maltiness but thats about it. Mouthfeel is a little bit oily and there is very little carbonation. Its a beer alright but theres not much else to it.
Lots of roasted malts. Dark cacao, oak, espresso beans. Spicy nut bread. Pacific hops. Great balance. Medium finish

Dark Brown black pour from a bottle with a medium khaki head. Nose is dark roasted malt domination with some coffee and lots of earthiness. Taste is a nice mix up front of dark malt, hop, some rye, into a sweet coffee hazelnut finish.
Dark brown, medium head. Fudge aroma. Vanilla and chocolate taste. Rather sweet and rather thin.
Looks pretty, slight smell of chocolate. I dont love this beer, but I could drink another if needed.

Tap at brewery. Pours deep, dark brown with creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, rye, chocolate, raisins, earthy notes, and faint ash. Flavor is dry roast malts forward, dark chocolate bitterness, espresso, ash, and faint dark fruit esters; dry ashy finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draft at the brewery. Pours black with a thin, fizzy beige head. Tastes like creamy, sweet cinnamon and cocoa, with a light pepper spice. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet cocoa, brown sugar, and cream.

Bottled:Pours black with a mid sized head. Aroma is fudge, chocolate and marsh mallows. Surprisingly thin mouth feel; almost watery! Taste is quite dry and has notes of smoke, wood, fudge and some chocolate. Harsh finish. Nope, didnt like this one! Too dry.

Sample at Daily Growler. Pours dark brown with a medium tan head that recedes gradually. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malt, hops and coffee. Medium-bodied with flavors of roasted coffee, earthy hops and malt. The finish is subtle rye bread with a malty aftertaste. Decent overall.

Roasted/burnt notes, coffee, bread, nuts in aroma. Very pleasant!
Clear, dark brown with one finger beige head.
Medium sweetness with a nice light backing bitterness. Almost a sticky feel to it, but medium bodied.
Overall really nice!

Pours black with a dense, light tan head that leaves lots of scuzzy lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, light maple syrup (power of as suggestion?). Flavor is roasted malt, light licorice, coffee, light spiciness. Mildly sweet, mildly bitter. Medium mouthfeel.
A very mild aroma with hints of coffee and vanilla bean. Pours dark black and has taste of coffee, cream and slightly sweet at the start but very malty finish. Best one of the series yet

Bottle, 355ml - Opaque dark brown beer, with a small off white head. Aroma is malty with notes of chocolate, molasses, licorice and caramel. Flavor is malty with notes of molasses, chocolate, nuts, caramel and spices. Very enjoyable and soft beer.

Had it on tap here in NYC. Best new beer of the year (very young year, I know). Great taste... and aftertaste. Full body, lingers long after youve finished. High alcohol without the alcohol taste, A great discovery!
user_location: New York NY, New York, USA

text: Svart med ljusbrunt skum! Kaffe, choklad ock lite lakrits i både doft och smak! Lite rökig men helt ok! Lite för söt o blaskig!
Svart med medelstort moccafärgat skum. Dofter och smaker av lakrits, kaffe, krispig citrus med svag rökighet. Medelsbeska.

@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (30:-). Trevligt öl, nästan lite stoutaktigt. I doft/smak finns choklad, lakrits, kaffe, rostade toner. Medelfyllig, något torr, hyfsad beska, fin avslutning av bl.a. kaffe.
Bottle pours a dark chocolate brown with coffee, honey, caramel, and roasted malt aromas. This beers flavor evolves just as brewers claim on the main ratebeer description. Delicious!!
Wonderful blueberry and chocolate aroma, with hints of coffee and apple pie. Taste of raisins, yeast, coffee, nuts, and berries. Creamy on the palate.

Black bodied, tapped with small head. Rustic, fresh yeast, grains, German style rye bread, spelt. Thick enough rye body, active carbonation. Smooth herbal bitterness. Black IPA in taste, porter in aroma, with that added fullness of the rye. Delicious, really what I wanted right now! (Pint at Rattle n Hum New York)
Black pour at sheffields. Tiny brown head. Nutty and chocolate flavor. Malty. Earthy. Good

Draft at Beer Run. Pours a clear dark brown color with a thin brown head. Fair head retention. Aroma of heavy rye notes, stone fruits, mild roasted malts. The taste is caramel, roasted malts, rye, bitter hops, mild toastiness. Medium bodied, decent balance.

Black pour. Big creamy light brown head. Plenty of lacing. A peppery malt aroma. Some coffee and chocolate as well. Chocolate and molasses taste with some big alcohol notes coming through. Very boozy. Not bad.

On tap at ORiley & Conways, pours black with a tan head, the aroma is really creamy with lots of chocolate and cocoa, the flavor has some of the rye coming through with some spice too, but the chocolate really over powers everything here, this seems to be pretty close to stout territory in my mind.

Bottle. 
Dark brown with a beige head. 
Roasted, fruity, hazelnuts, some chocolate and licorice, a bit of spices. 
Medium-bodied.

Bottle shared with my dad on Festivus. Pours a dark black with a thin to medium sized beige to tan head that deflates quickly. Some spicy rye and citrus right away on the nose, caramel over long roast. Medium-bodied, cocoa, chocolate, a bit of rye. Warm citrus and roast on the finish. Cocoa, lingering light bitterness.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Dark brown with a small, tan head. 
Earthy chocolate in the aroma. 
Thick and oily palate. Medium bitterness. 
Chocolate and cold, sweet coffee in the flavour along with salty soy-sauce.
Bottle->tumbler. Deep brown with small tan head. Roasted malt, dark chocolate, rye spice, pepper notes. Decent, if a bit thin.

12 ounce bottle - $1.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Ahh, the beer series I almost nearly always forget as the bottle label never changes (admittedly, their new labels are quite eye-catching).

Appearance: Pours a black body with a lean, light khaki-colored head that doesnt stick around too terribly long.

Smell: Roasty, sure, but, theres also a strong Munich toasty note present. Nice chocolate scented accent. Incorporated dark fruitiness, maybe a sliver of licorice. Minor rye. A very thin trace of smokiness. And all of the creamy, milk notes youd expect from a milk stout, cept this isnt!

Taste: Roast, deep toasted barley, and a coating of chocolate and whipping cream. Fair sweetness, some additional caramelized sugars. Modest rye character. A singular drop of smoky molasses. A light touch of dark fruits. Huh. You know, for a beer that isnt supposed have an infusion of lactose, for me, it definitely has a great milky/creamy quality to it. Faint, faint herb, citrus imparted by the hops. Sweetish, roasty, and still so smooth and milky on the finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Overall: I was actually expecting something a bit more along the lines of their previous Volume 4. Thankfully, that wasnt the case. V5 is the best non-milk non-stout Ive had in quite some time!

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with a minimal tan head and leaves a bit of spotty lacing that mostly slides back down into the beer. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, rye, wood, dark fruits, and a bit of smoke. Their description of the taste is pretty accurate. Definitely picking up nut bread, more of a cocoa taste that molasses, licorice, rye, black pepper, a bit of coffee, and a nice earthy hop finish. Medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation, long somewhat bitter finish of roasty malts and hops. Just an all around great brew. Every year since Vol. 1 I have made sure I have picked up a 6 of Left Hands Fade to Black series, and I have yet to be disappointed. Vol. 5 is certainly a worthy addition! Very nice.
Huge coffee aroma. Taste is coffee, chocolate with the rye spice at end. Finish smooths out s nice chocolate.

Scents of grains ready to be baked. Pretty to look at when poured from a typically cool Left Hand label. Long, almost puckeringly bitter finish. Very nice weight from an imposing, dark look. So good it makes me sad I missed the first four entries in the series.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2014 Temporary rating. At some point I might re-write this.

Blackish brown, small dark mocha head, quick diss, small trace.
Malty, tiny spicy, roasted malts, pumpernickel, black pepper corns, resinous wood, pine needles, grass, grapefruit rinds, raisins
Bitter, dark bread, cereal, resinous wood, pine needles, grass, liquorice, pepper corns, toffee, prunes. 
Round, medium.
Bitter, toffee, dark bread, pine, liquorice, resinous wood,
Solid rye bipa.

Flaska från Systembolaget . Fin dark/black Ale. Lite rå och kärv men god!! Gillar!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Alchemy. Creamy chocolate body. Hints of cardamom and hops. Smooth caramel-chocolate. Easy, light on the palate..almost a nitro feelm certainly no biting carbonation. Herbal tones lingers in the finish, a touch of black pepper maybe? Very easy drinking considering it is approaching Imperial Stout territory. Well done.
Bottle. Black with a lightbrown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, cacao, licorice, syrup. Sweet and roasty taste. Medium body, sweet finish with slight bitterness.

Ar: rye, roasted malts, coffee, licorice, dry, ash, woody, alcohol. 
Ap: black colour, medium beige head, lacing.
T: medium bite, noticable hoppiness, floral, fruity, salty, lightly sweet, coffee and licorice. 
P: medium/fullbodied, average carbonation, salty and bitter finish.
O: enjoyable.
Aroma is spicy rye and lactic acid/milk. The flavor is spicy rye, milk/lactic acid, very slight heat and a late tangy/sour finish. Kind of like their Milk Stout with rye and pepper in it.

Advent beer #23: 12oz bottle - Nose is roasted coffee. Sip adds licorice and almost burnt flavors. A little flat. All kinds of bitter. Almost a black IPA. Bready and spicy aftertaste. One more hour until I find out what my Christmas Eve beer is - cant wait!!!!
Draft. From notes. Caramel with good doses of coffee and dark chocolate. Decent spicy rye kick. Enjoyable.
Dark stout in color, light is taste. Great taste without the heavy alcohol taste of some higher ABV stouts.
Bottle from Systembolaget (30 SEK). Dark brown color. Aroma of chocolate and coffee.Taste adds some bitterness and hops. Very nice!

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a small head.
Aroma: Roasted caramel, chocolate, spices, coffee.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, caramel, spices.

Bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of bakers, cocoa, roastiness, rye and light earthiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of rye, bakers cocoa, light roastiness and light earthiness with a smooth dry lingering cocoa/rye finish.

Draught at Bishops Arms Gustav.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel, dark chocolate, bread and licorice.
Sweet and roasted flavour of caramel, bread and licorice.
Roasted finish.
Pitch black pour with a fluffy cream/khaki head. Nose is heavy rye, coffee, chocolate, and dry. Smooth palate, roasted malts, rye, chocolate, licorice, and a great finish.

Bottle. Pours brownish black barely see through. Aroma of coffee, malts, vanilla? Very smooth! Well balanced. Not too heavy. Nice!

----Hophaze out
Svart-riktigt mörk röd öl med brunt skum. Doft: Kola, honungs melon, kakao, lite lakrits och torkad frukt. Smak: Grädd kola, kaffe, lakrits stång med citrus mitt.

Sampled on draft at Portrait House. Not quite clear dark brown pour with amber highlights and just a fair ring of tan head. Nose of wood and coffee and tobacco leaves with a nutty/maple/brownale flavor combo. The spiciness of the rye creeps up on you only on the tail end. But other than that, its really not overly done at all. Pretty good, but not needing to have it again.
Serving: Draft at Fire Works Leesburg. Odd cherry notes in the nose. Little wood, dark fruit, and spicy rye flavorwise. Oily finish. Interesting brew.

The aroma is malt - kinda hay, a little toasty. Pours just about black with a small brown frothy head that is fully diminishing. The taste is a light bitter. The body is light to medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish a light bitter. Not bad, easy to drink.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Black beer with a beige head. Roasted cocoa aroma, spicy, chocolate, vanilla notes, licorice, some coffee. Chocolate flavor, nutty notes, cocoa, some spices, earthy, floral, tar notes, some cocoa. Chilli finish with chocolate and chocolate. A bit dull.
bottle, black pour, medium body. roasted maltiness, lighter notes of wood & coffee. Rye spiciness, light anise/licorice. Pretty good

355ml bottle, pours clear brownish black with a small tan head that quickly dissipated. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark maple syrup, coffee, spices and a hint of rye. Light sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. A delicious beer, but the rye is barely noticeable, and I could have missed it entirely if I didnt know to look for it.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours black with a tan head. Taste slightly sweet, roasted malt, rye. I thought this was good. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with almost no head. ARoma is chocolate, coffee, honey, roasted malts, rye bread, some hoppy / fruity flavors. Taste is chocolate, honey, brown sugar, slight liqourice and spicy, peppery notes. Quite good!

12 oz bottle. Pours black with a thin tan ring. Aroma is almost straight up rye bread, subtle but nice. More toasted rye bread in the flavor, with a bit of pecan and star anise. Thin bodied, finishes slightly burnt.

The appearance is an opaque very dark reddish brown with a small tan head that leaves a ring on top of the beer after fading, and the fairly subtle aroma fuses rye with roasted malts. The taste combines a mild umami with a slight sweetness and a touch of sourness (the rye is quite apparent), and the palate combines a slick texture, medium body, soft carbonation, and a finish that keeps the rye in your mouth.

12oz bottle shared with Ed5388. Poured a thinner watery pitch black with a super small foamy tight foamy beige head. Aroma of chocolate, dar bread, slight rye spiceyness and some chocolate cake batter. Medium bodied that is a slight touch dry on the end along with average carbonation. Flavor of burnt toast, touch of dark coffee beans, chocolate and vanilla extract, some citrus rind with warmth. Meh this one is just okay.

12oz bottle from Crossroads Spirits. Pours black with a super thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, and spices. Taste of rye malt, roasted malt, chocolate, black pepper, and spices. Decent mouthfeel, with low carbonation.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Clear near black, minimal head. Chocolate and molasses up front. Sweetish with medium-full body and rounded mouthfeel. Syrup ahd chocolate, some pepper. Mid bitter finish.

Pours dark brown with low tan head. Aroma of coffee, citrus, chocolate malts, light grapefruit. Taste is balanced chocolate sweet and hoppy bitter with light coffee in the finish. Light crisp body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

theres a bomb in the freezer .. . deep black . . mild foam, strong lacing .. mild mouthfeel .. . notes of deep burnt rye and toast so burnt it falls apart when you try to put even the smallest dab of butter on it, and forget peanut butter- youre shit outta luck on that one...
Bottle. Deep deep brown with small light brown head. Malty nut aroma. Taste is heavy rye and malt but is slightly astringent in mouth.-- rated with beerbasher
Pours dark brown, almost black, small brown head with good lacing. Delicious nutty aroma with floral. Great taste, bitter-sweet.
Aroma of chocolate and sour mash. Dark brown colour without much of a head. Smooth taste of chocolate with a hint of phenols. Mild palate with just a hint of phenol.

Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, very small tan head. Syrup, malt mash aroma. Light smoke and sweet malt body with a watery finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours black with an off-white head. Smells nutty, caramel, coffee, has a really complex smell that is amazing! Has a very nutty flavor, slight roast, caramel. Its a really good.
Bottled, dark brown color with khaki foam, caramel and roasty toffee aroma, flavor is good coffee , dark fruits, earthy caramel and well balanced finish
Bottle. The look is dark, black in color, with a creamy tan head. The smell is roasty, coffee, malts, sweetness, and chocolate. The taste is a malty sweetness, pepper, sticky, nuts, and chocolate.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, dark black pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of rye, spice, slight orange, hints of grass, pine in there, pretty nice smelling with some dark cocoa, roast as well. Taste is a mix of dark cocoa, roast, hints of grass, slight pine, touch of orange peel, rye in there, finishing bitter, dry. Tasty.

caramel, toast, roasty, coffee, floral, herbs, earthy, basement aromas, soy sauce, vanilla, black, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, slick feel, average carbonation, average carbonation, astringent,

Had on tap in a pint glass.

Pours a clear very dark brown, nearly pitch black, with a small half finger tan head.

The aroma is very toasty with some coffee and char. Pine is present from the hops but it is not all that complex.

Mouthfeel has pine and earth and a fairly strong bitterness from the get go. The rye sort of lingers in the background and is not as prominent as I was hoping. Mouthfeel is quite chalky with a sticky finish.

Overall, the rye is just too suppressed in this beer and the hops are too up front. It lacks balance and is really not all that interesting. Oh well, glad I got to try it.
On tap. Comes nearly black with a small biege head. Aroma of malt and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, rye, and licorice. Pretty good.
Bottle - Dark brown, almost black in colour. Roasted malt and a hint of coffee in the aroma. Roasted and malty taste with plain chocolate, rye and grain detected.
12 oz bottle. Black in color with an average beige head. Aroma is of roasted malt, rye bread, smoke, and coffee. Taste is of rye, cocoa, tobacco, and roasted malt.

12 oz bottle pours black with thin dark tan head that dissipates quickly. Active carbonation. Mild lacing. Nose is mostly toasty malts and coffee. Tastes bittersweet throughout. Great balance of coffee bitter, cocoa, and liquorice. Creamy mouthful. Good beer.

Bottle, Systembolaget. 

Clear dark brown with a medium head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, dark bread, some coffee and syrup. Soft and easy to drink. An ok beer although nothing spectacular.

12 oz bottle from Tipsys. Black with a small tan head. The aroma and flavor is spicy rye, roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, wood, licorice, molasses and black pepper balanced by earthy bitter hops. Medium body with a soft creamy feel and a smooth lingering finish.

Single bottle from Lemon Tree. A rich, creamy pour like an oatmeal stout offers a back body with a thick cappuccino colored head. Smell has a bit of sweetened cocoa and licorice. Taste is bitingly spicy, thanks to the rye. Claimed earthy (English?) hops help to emphasize the malt. Tends to the try side like most of Left Hands stout formulations.
Bottle. Poured black with a tan head. Rye and chocolate in the nose. Dark chocolate and rye flavors are strong. Best on of this series Ive had
Pours very dark black. Nice coffee nose with other dark notes. Makes for a great dessert alternative to a heavier stout. Would definitely drink again.

From a 12 oz bottle. 

Pours darkdarkdark with a thin film of caramel colored head. Mild aroma of malt. Taste is less mild, and pretty good. Touch of burnt coffee to go with the malt. 

(Hard to specify as this is being tasted after having an absolutely delightfully raw Victory Dirt Wolf... Not a palate wrecker, but so different as to give the palate whiplash)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown to black with a thin mocha head that leaves some light, spotty lace. Nose involves brown sugar, cola, dark bread, nuttiness, herbal and earthy hops, and licorice. Flavor is quite sweet with some bitterness. Light to medium bodied, oily if a bit thin, sticky, with a long crusty bread finish. A decent brew, but lacking depth and rye influence for me.
Earthy, sweet, and slightly hoppy aroma. Pours dark black with a thick lasting light tan head. Roasty, toasty, earthy, nutty. A little burntness on the finish with a hint of hops bitterness. Not bad.

Location/Date:Bottle on 11/17/2013.
Appearance: Pours a dark black
Aroma: Aroma light coffee, faint wood smoke.
Taste: Nutty, lightly sweet, faint licorice, light rye, light wood smoke.
Palate:Medium body, really slick with a quick aftertaste..
Summary: An interesting take on a rye beer, which provided a really excellent palate. Didnt get as much earthy hops as description says, but an enjoyable black almost ipa.

Clear dark dark brown with a big foamy khaki head. The nose has a load of roasted rye malts, basically smells like rye pumpernickel bread. Thankfully the flavor is a bit more complex and tasty, with notes of sweet roasty cocoa, a light kiss of coffee, and a bit of spicy rye bready tones throughout. Semi sweet roast finish.
Dark black in color with a minimal cream colored head. Not much aroma, but what I do get is hints if roasted coffee. Very smooth drinking beer. Im getting a roasty chocolaty flavor.

12 oz. bottle at home. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small khaki head that doesnt last. The aroma and flavor have nicely roasted malts, coffee, spicy rye bread, some background sweet notes, perhaps a hint of molasses, earthy hops. Mildly peppery, mild + bitterness to the finish, with good body. Tasty and for the right price.

12 ounce bottle, best before 04/01/14 stamped on bottle. Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours dark brown/black with a 2 inch tan head. Head retention is good, and theres also a lot of lacing. The brew smells like roasted malt, dark/rye bread, nuts and some coffee. It tastes like roasted and burnt/charred malt, bittersweet chocolate, dark/rye bread, nuts, and a bit of molasses and coffee. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit slick and coating, with moderate carbonation. I think its a good brew, definitely worth a try at $9.99 a 6-pack.
Pours dark brown with tan head. Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is awesome! Like a porter feel with a stout chocolate taste and a rye spice. Finishes smooth. Wow.
A nice edition to the FTB Series. The rye backbone holds up nicely to the char.

These fade to black beers are about the only products I still buy from Left Hand, and truthfully, I look forward to the new release each year - as Ive come to expect, this is a solid beer, but probably my least favorite in the series so far (but only by a tiny bit) - pours looking like cola - nose is a hearty mixture of roasted malts and toasty, spicy rye, with some earthy notes and moderate chocolate sweetness - body is medium - moderate carbonation, leading the a kind of slick mouthfeel on the back end - fairly sweet, but with moderate acidity, light char, roast, and spicy rye, all of which offset that sweetness for the most part - finish is slightly warming and moderately spicy, with some licorice flavor - some lingering sweetness on the tongue is a little unwelcome - pretty good brew.

Whole Foods, Bowery 355ml ($2): Pours black with a smallish tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, molasses, licorice, a bit of hops, and some light rye. Taste is subdued roasted rye. Some hoppiness. Plenty of earthiness. Relatively little amounts of sweetness. Interesting combination of flavors that evades most standard classifications.

Bottle. Opaque black pour with a short, dense brown head. Aroma is kind of smoky with strong roasted malt notes, dark chocolate, hints of coffee and caramel. Taste is roasted malt, smoked wood, dark chocolate, light licorice, caramel notes and coffee. Not much rye to this. Body is medium but soft with a dense, creamy carbonation and moderate stickiness. Ends with more roasted malt, smoked malt, dark chocolate, candy notes, coffee, light licorice and caramel notes.

Draft. Pours a medium, poorly retained, beige head, with minimal lacing, over a clear dark brown (SRM 35) body.....nose is early coffee, later chocolate, cocoa, with rye, minimal hops, no esters.....taste is rye spice, chocolate, cocoa, dry throughout, finish is moderate bitterness, rye, and roasted malts linger, with the mild bitterness.....mouth feel medium, alcohol hidden, carbonation gives a creamy texture, with mild acid tingle. This is a delicious, well balanced beer with good complexity in both aroma and flavor. BJCP 9/3/16/5/7

12oz bottle. Mostly clear dark brown / reddish color. Nice thin khaki head when pouring, fades to a minimal ring though, and doesnt leave much lace. Crisp carbonation of moderate strength, but a good, chewy, bigger body. Nice complex dark aroma - coffee, spicy rye, little maple and a reasonable (small) amount of licorice, as well as a solid amount of earthy hop bitterness. Light spicy sweetness. Aside from the bigger body, alcohol is hidden well. Solid black rye ale. A unique combo of flavors, and they work well. Kudos to Left Hand for coming up with a distinctly different black ale every year, I like this series.

Bottle. Poured a dark brown color with a moderate frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted sweet malt, coffee and wood aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy complex dark sweet flavor with a medium dark sweet tingly finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable brew.

Truly a Great craft Rye Ale to bring in the Fall season. I loved the pour on this, a nice tan head with some smooth sweetness coming off the nose and that of coffee and maybe even some roasted nuts and molasses. Taste was spot on and I thoroughly enjoyed this beer!

Sampled at the brewery. The aroma is roasted malts, slight smoke, rye maltiness. The flavor its roasted malts, chocolate, malty, slight acidity from the roasted malts. Hints of spice, probably from the rye malts.
